text:
e="preserve">Wendy Blunsden (9 February 1942 – 1 August 2020) was an Australian cricketer. She captained the Australia national women's cricket team in one Test match and played a total of seven tests. She was born in Adelaide. She made her Test debut against New Zealand in 1972.
Blunsden died on 1 August 2020, aged 78.
